articles.title: Canterbury Farm, ‘a treasure to the Berkshires,’ closes after 40 years
articles.description:
"It was a lot of fun," said Linda Bacon about running the Berkshires business for four decades.

The post Canterbury Farm, ‘a treasure to the Berkshires,’ closes after 40 years appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Canterbury Farm in the Berkshires closes after 40 years of operation.
Owner Linda Bacon reflects on four decades of fun and community engagement.
Closure impacts local tourism and agricultural activities in the Berkshires region.

articles.title: Patriots will be without three key players for matchup vs. Buccaneers
articles.description:
Rhamondre Stevenson, Kayshon Boutte, and Christian Elliss have all been ruled out for Sunday.

The post Patriots will be without three key players for matchup vs. Buccaneers appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots will miss Rhamondre Stevenson, Kayshon Boutte, and Christian Elliss for Sunday’s game.
Stevenson is a key running back, impacting the team's offensive strategy against the Buccaneers.
Fans should prepare for potential changes in game dynamics due to these injuries.

articles.title: Is Drake Maye the MVP? Execs don’t think so, but several analysts do.
articles.description:
Maye has statistically been one of the league's top passers this season, helping the Patriots get out to a 7-2 start.

The post Is Drake Maye the MVP? Execs don’t think so, but several analysts do. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Drake Maye leads the Patriots to a strong 7-2 record this season.
Analysts praise Maye's performance, ranking him among the top passers in the league.
Maye's success could boost local support for the Patriots as playoff hopes rise.

articles.title: Who makes the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston?
articles.description:
Nearly every bar and restaurant in Greater Boston makes a version of an espresso martini. But who makes the best?

The post Who makes the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Explore the top espresso martini spots in Greater Boston's vibrant bar scene.
Numerous bars and restaurants compete, showcasing unique versions of the cocktail.
Local residents can discover new favorites and support local businesses through this trend.

articles.title: Travelers face delays, cancellations at Logan Airport after FAA names it among airports impacted by the shutdown
articles.description:
"We are very concerned," wrote one reader.

The post Travelers face delays, cancellations at Logan Airport after FAA names it among airports impacted by the shutdown appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Logan Airport experiences significant delays and cancellations due to FAA shutdown announcement.
Travelers report increased wait times, affecting thousands of passengers daily.
Local businesses near Logan may suffer revenue losses from decreased airport traffic.

articles.title: 10 noteworthy stats after a month of hockey for 2025-26 Bruins
articles.description:
The Bruins' defensive structure has tightened up during this five-game win streak.

The post 10 noteworthy stats after a month of hockey for 2025-26 Bruins appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Bruins' defense improved significantly during their current five-game win streak.

Local fans can expect enhanced game experiences as Bruins continue to perform well.

articles.title: More Massachusetts residents say their finances are in poor shape, UMass poll finds
articles.description:
The latest UMass/WCVB survey shows financial confidence at its lowest point since tracking began in 2021.

The post More Massachusetts residents say their finances are in poor shape, UMass poll finds appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: UMass/WCVB survey reveals financial confidence among Massachusetts residents is at its lowest since 2021.
43% of respondents reported feeling their finances are in poor shape, a significant increase from previous years.
Decreased financial confidence may lead to reduced spending and economic challenges for Boston businesses.

articles.title: Fitchburg police defend actions during ICE arrest after man appears to seize while holding child
articles.description:
A top Homeland Security official said emergency medical personnel “found no legitimate medical episode,” despite the chaotic scene filmed by bystanders.

The post Fitchburg police defend actions during ICE arrest after man appears to seize while holding child appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Fitchburg police defended their actions during an ICE arrest involving a man holding a child.
Emergency medical personnel reported no legitimate medical episode despite bystanders filming the incident.
The incident raises concerns about police and ICE interactions within the Boston community.
